item.title: Scripting Help
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:3, topic:537855”]Yup. Move mouse only has 2 parameters.

I assume it should be:
MoveMouse(X, Y);
wait(250);
ClickMouse(X, Y, mouse_Left)[/quote]

I think ClickMouse(X, Y, mouse_Left) needs a semi colon. I wouldn’t know.

Read full topic

item.title: Scripting Help
item.dc:creator: @U_S_M_C U S M C
item.description:
@U_S_M_C wrote:

Okay guys, I am new to Moparscape and this is my first post actually. I got my own server and everything, I know how to do everything to get it online etc. But before I am going to release it to the public, I wanted to add some scripts to the server. Which I know how to add them, I’ve downloaded Simba scripts before and put them into my server to use. But here I am asking how to make a simple script for like… Cooking? I’ve downloaded Simba and got this code so far:

program CookFood; Procedure ClickRange; var X,Y:Integer; begin if FindColorTolerance(X, Y, 1385125, 326, 321, 368, 318, 5) then begin MoveMouse(326, 321,1,1); wait(250); // LINE 9!!!!!!@!@!@!@!@!@!@!@!@!@!@!@!@!@!@!@!@!@!@!@!@@ ClickMouse(326, 321, mouse_Left) end; end; Begin MouseSpeed := 15; SetupSRL; end.
But when I go to compile it, I keep getting this error:

[Error] C:\Simba\Scripts\Cooking Find Color.simba(9:24): Invalid number of parameters at line 9 Compiling failed.
Now all this is so far is using the find color tool that Simba provides. That is finding the range to click on, I am not sure what is wrong?

EDIT
Just for all of you to know what exactly I am trying to do, if there is an easier way;
I am trying to get Simba to find the color of the range close by, then use food in inventory on it, then click on bank, click bank all button, and then rightclick the food and hit all, then exit and repeat.
EDITED

Read full topic
